c74object.name: the.cache
c74object.digest: View and empty a Max application's cache folder
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2020, www.xenorama.com.
View and delete any unwanted files from Max' cache folder. When used in an executable/standalone requires the application's name as argument or symbol in rightmost inlet.

objarg.name: standalone-name
objarg.description: Name of standalone application. By default, the.cache manages the cache folder of the Max application (default: Max 8). An additional symbol can be provided to manage the cache folder of the Max standalone by the same name instead.

attribute.name: types
attribute.description:
Specify file types to filter. See the gettypes method to post supported filetype-nomenclature to the Max window or check the folder helpfile.
The default is types without any argument, listing and managing all files.

attribute.name: post
attribute.digest: Post executed commands to Max Window
attribute.description: Post executed commands to Max Window (default: 1). When disabled, the user will not be notified about cleared files, however, the abstraction is based around node.script which posts its file handling steps to the console.

method.name: bang
method.digest: Populate attached menu with cache files
method.description:
Populate attached menu with cache files. If a umenu or chooser is connected to the middle outlet of the.cache, sending bang to the first inlet will populate the menu with all files in the cache folder specified by the types attribute.
The menu entries can be used to manually remove single files using the remove method.

method.name: empty
method.digest: Will delete all files from the cache folder
method.description: Will delete all files from the cache folder of the specified filetype.

method.name: reveal
method.digest: Open and view the cache folder
method.description: The word reveal Will launch the filebrowser and open the cahce folder.

method.name: remove
method.digest: Delete single files from cache folder
method.description: Delete single files from cache folder. Only the filename is required, not the entire filepath since it is assumed we are targeting the cache folder.

method.name: gettypes
method.digest: Post supported filetypes to the max console
method.description: Post supported filetypes to the max console. The match those filetypes supported by the fodler object. Any of the listed filetypes can be specified using the types attribute.
